selectedVerses.text: Its vestibule faced the outer court, and palm trees were on its jambs, and its stairway had eight steps.
When they went, they went in any of their four directions without turning as they went, but in whatever direction the front wheel faced, the others followed without turning as they went.

Then he brought me back to the door of the temple, and behold, water was issuing from below the threshold of the temple toward the east (for the temple faced east). The water was flowing down from below the south end of the threshold of the temple, south of the altar.
a hard-faced nation who shall not respect the old or show mercy to the young.
As for the gate that faced toward the north, belonging to the outer court, he measured its length and its breadth.
